sk.title: Titul
sk.seasyText: Full stack vývoj. Seasy je námorný Start-up, ktorý sa sústredí na vývoj rezervačnej platformy, ktorá spája námorníkov s marínami. Moja hlavná úloha vo firme bol programovať, ale práca taktiež obsahovala výskum, plánovanie a iné "product management" zodpovednosti.
sk.seasyTech: Prevládajúce technológie: ReactJS, Relay, MUI, Node.js, Knex.js
sk.seasyGraph: si môžete pozrieť jedoduchý graf, ako asi vyzerala infraštruktúra webovej časti produktu.
sk.4nets: Vývoj a údržba interných webových projektov
sk.4netsTech: Prevládajúce technológie: ReactJS, Typescript, GraphQL, Django
sk.sportradarTech: Prevládajúce technológie: Node.js, VueJS, Serverless, AWS
sk.kuberSro: Kontrakt pre spoločnosť KUBER, spol. s.r.o.
sk.kuberSroText: Vývoj interného informačného systému pre predajňu autodielov. Tvorba zahŕňala tvorbu technickej špecifikácie a následne implementácie rôznych modulov (sklad, predajňa). Systém poskytoval REST API pre e-shop.
sk.fmfi: Fakulta matematiky, fyziky a informatiky Univerzity Komenského v Bratislave
sk.AI: Základné znalosti o princípoch a fungovaní ML modelov a ich parametrov
sk.numpy: Základná práca s dátami, vektormi, maticami, knižnicami (numpy, scikit-learn, matplotlib)
sk.titleExit: Ďakujem za prečítanie. Teším sa na stretnutie.
sk.seasyJob:
Práca v SEASY bola pravá Start-up skúsenosť. Čo sa týka technológií, pracovali sme s Node.js backendom, Postgresql databázou. Prácu s ňou sme si uľahčovali s Knex.js query builder library. Apollo Server bol náš GraphQL server a celé to bolo hostované na Cloudinary. Repozitár sme mali v GitLabe, kde bežali aj pipeline-y. Mimo našej vlastnej logiky ohľadom booking procesu sme implementovali integráciu na API externých systémov marín.

Frontend bol napísaný v Reacte s vlasným webpack config-om. Pužívali sme Relay ako náš GraphQL client, styled-components na štýlovanie, i18next a Phrase na preklady a mapbox na map experience. Na platby sme používali Stripe. Taktiež bola mojou zodpovednosťou koordinácia s externým dodávateľom mobilnej aplikácie, ktorá bola vyvíjaná v React Native, neskôr po ukončení vývoja, som prebral zodpovednosť za údržbu aplikácie. Mimo programovania obsahovala práca v Seasy aj úlohy orientované viac na produktovú prácu - výskum, plánovanie funkcionalít, priorizáciu a iné strategicky orientované úlohy.. Napríklad stretávanie sa so skúsenými ľuďmi z odvetvia námorného softvéru, alebo účasť na obchodných výstavách a festivaloch.
sk.fournetsJob:
Vo 4networks som pracoval v malom tíme (2-4 developeri), ale na rozsiahlom webovom projekte. Projekt zahŕňal veľa rôznych technológií, pričom s väčšinou z nich som prichádzal do pravidelného kontaktu. Weby slúžili ako tematické komunitné portály a dokopy ich mesačne navštívi viac ako 500 000 užívateľov zo Slovenska a Česka.

Frontend je napísaný v ReactJS (class based, potom hooks samozrejme). V minulosti prebiehal vývoj v Javascript-e, posledné 2 roky v Typescript-e. Na komunikáciu s backendom sa využíval REST-like API a GraphQL s frameworkom Apollo. V projekte sme používali CRA Webpack konfiguráciu, ktorú sme si prispôsobili našim potrebám. Tento setup predchádzal custom webpack config.

React-ová aplikácia je rozsiahla (100k+ riadkov v .tsx) obsahovala ssr, code-splitting, internalizáciu, custom systém štýlovania, lazy-loading a veľa ďalších 'chuťoviek' web-developmentu. V minulosti sme používali na state management mobx, neskôr najmä React State & Context + Apollo Cache.

Backend bol napísaný v Djangu. Prístup k dátam prebiehal najmä cez ORM, ale samotná databáza bola PostgresQL. Niektoré dáta boli indexované v Elasticsearch, niektoré boli v Redise. Systém bol self-hosted (VNet) a bežal na FreeBSD / Linux serveroch.

Počas tohoto obdobia som vyvíjal na Linuxe. Veci, ako práca s Git-om, práca v tíme a dobrá komunikácia považujem za samozrejmosť.
sk.school:
V mojom magisterskom štúdiu na FMFI som si vybral špecializáciu na umelú inteligenciu. Naučil som sa základné princípy algoritmov strojového učenia , proces trénovania, validovania, testovania. Preberali sme regresiu, SVMká, neurónové siete (lineárne, rekurentné), samo organizujúce sa mapy...

Poznám a rozumiem konceptom ako napr. predspracovanie dát, normalizácia, regularizácia, bias & variance, preučenie & podučenie, hyperparametre a architektúry základných ML modelov. Robil som viacero projektov (do školy a po nej), ale treba povedať, že nemám real-life skúsenosť s prácou v tejto oblasti. Čo mám, sú dobré základy na ďalšie vzdelávanie a spoznanie implementácií v produkčných systémoch.
sk.freeTime:
Vo voľnom čase sa periodicky venujem projektom a technológiám, ktoré ma zaujmú. V minulosti som napríklad pri skúšaní React UI framworkov spravil Reactovú web appku na zdieľanie 'filmov na pozretie' s kamarátmi s Ant Designom + Hasura. S Next.js + Material UI zas appku na trackovanie teploty vody v jazerách, pričom sa cez Apple Shortcuts som robil len API calls.

Momentálne je môj primárny hobby projekt a záujem na Flutter-i od Google-u. Mobile development vo Flutter-i sa učím cca rok. Najprv kurz od codebrewery, neskôr jednoduché appky. Aktuálne vyvíjam mobilnú (resp. cross-platform) aplikáciu na organizovanie kolektívnych športových udalostí. Nadväzuje na funkcionalitu starého PHP systému http://futsys.sk/.

Mimo iného aplikácia obsahuje integráciu na SVM klasifikátor, ktorý predikuje víťaza amatérskeho zápasu. Systém podľa tejto predikcie ponúka kurzovú ponuku a možnosť členom partie, ktorí nehrajú v danom zápase, staviť si virtuálne peniaze na výsledok zápasu.
Aplikácia zatiaľ nie je dokončená, plán je prvú verziu dokončiť a testovať ju s partiami kamarátov počas júna. Prikladám screenshoty pre predstavu.

en.title: Academic degree
en.sportradarText: Fullstack software engineer in a team of ~10 people
en.sportradarTech: Core technologies used: Node.js, VueJS, Serverless, AWS
en.seasyText: Full stack development. Seasy is a Digital Maritime Start-up focused on building a Booking / Reservation platform. My primary role is programming, but the work also comes with other responsibilities, such as research, planning and project management.
en.seasyTech: Core technologies used: ReactJS, Relay, MUI, Node.js, Knex.js
en.seasyLink: See the platform for yourself at www.seasy.at
en.seasyGraph: take a look at a simple graph of the web project infrastructure I've made.

en.kuberSro: Contract work for the company KUBER, spol. s.r.o.
en.kuberSroText: Development of an custom information system for a car parts store. The work included creation of a technical specification and the subsequent implementation of various modules (warehouse, store). The system provided a REST API for an e-shop.
en.kuberSroTech: Core technologies used: Python, Django, Electron
en.fmfi: Faculty of Mathematics, Physics, and Informatics of Comenius University
en.fmfiAin: Bachelor study program in Applied Informatics
en.AI: Basic knowledge of the principles of ML models and their usage
en.numpy: Basic work with data, vectors, matrices & data manipulation libraries (numpy, scikit-learn, matplotlib)
en.titleExit: Thank you for reading. I look forward to meeting you in person.
en.seasyJob:
Working at SEASY was a full on Start-up experience. From the tech side we had a Node.js backend, Postgresql database, which we accessed using Knex.js query builder library. Apollo Server was our GraphQL server and for hosting we were using Cloudinary, pipelines were running in GitLab CI. Outside our own booking and customer modules, we were integrated with other marinas via API.

The web frontend was a React application with custom webpack config. We used Relay as our GraphQL client, styled-components for styling, i18next and Phrase for translations and mapbox was our map engine of choice. As a payment gateway we were using Stripe, which was a beautiful developer experience compared to my endeavour with Wirecard in the past.

I was also overlooking development of our native apps which were developed in react-native by an external company and I've later took over the maintenance of the project. Besides developing, my work was filled with competition research, feature planning, prioritization and other strategy oriented work such as meeting experienced people from the maritime software industry, or attending exhibitions and work-oriented festivals.
en.fournetsJob:
At 4networks I was a part of a small dev team (2-4 people). We were working on a large scale project, containing 5 products, that share a large part of the codebase. The codebase consists of many technologies, most of which I came into regular contact with. The products were social network sites that catered to a specific field of interests (housing / weddings / gardening). Overall, we had around 500 000 users in a month, and we served the Slovak & Czech market.

The frontend part was built with ReactJS (previously class based, then hooks of course). In the past, the code was written in Javascript. In the last 2 years we were using Typescript. Data transfer between backend was done via REST-like API and more recently via GraphQL, using Apollo framework and Graphene on backend. Our app was using a modified CRA Webpack configuration, with few custom loaders & plugins (for stuff such as generating .graphql typings, css-modules .scss typings). Way back, we were working with a fully custom webpack config.

The React app was fairly big, it contained 100k+ lines of code in .tsx files. It included ssr, code-splitting, internalization, custom system for styles overrides, lazy-loading and many other gems of web-development. In the past, we've used mobx for state management, then we switched to using React State & Context + Apollo Cache.

Backend codebase was using the Django framework. The data was accessed mainly via ORM, but the database itself is PostgresQL. Some searchable data was also indexed in Elasticsearch, some was stored in Redis. The system was self-hosted and runs on FreeBSD / Linux servers.

During my time there, I was developing on a Linux machine. Things, such as working with Git, teamwork and good communication are given to me.
en.school:
In my master's studies at Comenius University, my specialization was in Computer Science Methods. I've learned the basic principles of machine learning algorithms, the process of training, validation, testing. We did study regression, SVMs, neural networks (linear, recurrent), self-organizing maps, etc.

I am familiar with and understand the concepts such as data preprocessing, normalization, regularization, bias & variance, learning & underestimation, hyper-parameters and architectures of basic ML models. I have done several projects (in school, and after), but it must be said that I do not have real-life experience working in this area. What I have is a good foundation for further education and basis for understanding implementations in production systems.
en.freeTime:
In my hobby programming I usually explore libraries and technologies that catch my interest. In the past, I've implemented a web app for movie sharing with friends, while using Ant Design & Hasura. I've implemented an app in Next.js for tracking water temperature in lakes, controlled by API calls from Apple Shortcuts.

My main and more substantial focus now is on Flutter from Google. In my free time, I'm currently developing a mobile app for organizing amateur collective sport events on a regular basis. It builds on the functionality of an old PHP system http://futsys.sk/ .

Among other things, the application includes integration with an SVM classifier, which predicts the winner of an amateur match. This prediction is used in odds generation. The system then offers a possibility, for members of the group, to bet virtual money on the result of the match.
The application is not finished yet, the plan is to complete the first version and test it with groups of friends during June. I enclose screenshots for a clearer image.
